description: Master database of culinary processes with yield factors, time estimates, and nutrition impacts

changelog.2.0.0: Added parallelizable, passiveTime, heatLevel, yieldFactorOverrides, prerequisites, aliases. Added 14 missing common processes. Standardized equipment naming. Added ingredient categories.

peel.description: Remove outer skin or peel from ingredient
peel.notes: Yield varies by ingredient: onions ~95%, potatoes ~85%, carrots ~90%

trim.description: Remove ends, stems, roots, or unwanted parts
trim.notes: Minimal material loss, mostly ends and stems

core.description: Remove central core, seeds, or pit
core.notes: Apple/pear ~8% loss, bell pepper ~12% loss, pineapple ~50% loss

debone.description: Remove bones from meat or fish
debone.notes: Major yield loss - chicken thighs with bone ~60% yield, fish ~70%

shell.description: Remove shells from shellfish, nuts, or eggs

zest.description: Remove colored outer peel for flavor
zest.notes: Extract only - one lemon yields ~2g zest

dice.description: Cut into small uniform cubes (1/4 to 1/2 inch)

mince.description: Chop into very fine pieces (smaller than dice)
mince.notes: Very minimal loss, mostly from knife residue

julienne.notes: Requires trimming to create uniform rectangles first

chop.notes: Fast and rustic, minimal precision needed

cube.description: Cut into larger uniform cubes (3/4 to 1 inch)
cube.notes: Larger pieces for stews and roasting

shred.description: Cut or tear into thin strips
shred.notes: Can be done by hand (lettuce) or with tools (cheese)

grate.description: Reduce to small pieces using grater
grate.notes: Some loss to grater residue, especially with sticky ingredients

crush.description: Break down using pressure to release juices/oils
crush.notes: Use immediately for best flavor, oxidizes quickly

score.description: Make shallow cuts in surface for even cooking or presentation
score.notes: Helps fat render, allows seasonings to penetrate, or creates decorative patterns

drain.description: Remove liquid from cooked or soaked ingredients
drain.notes: Minimal loss, just removes cooking liquid

rinse.description: Wash under running water to remove dirt or starch
rinse.notes: May add slight water weight, removes surface starch from rice/grains

strain.description: Separate solids from liquids using fine mesh
strain.notes: Removes solids, keeps liquid - significant volume reduction

squeeze.notes: Extracts juice only - lemon yields ~35ml per 100g fruit

season.description: Add salt, pepper, or spices to taste
season.notes: Adds minimal weight from seasonings, critical for flavor

coat.description: Cover ingredient with flour, breadcrumbs, or batter

stuff.description: Fill cavity or pocket with filling

roll.description: Flatten dough or wrap ingredients by rolling

sprinkle.description: Scatter small amount of ingredient on top
sprinkle.notes: Adds minimal weight, enhances flavor and presentation

saute.description: Cook quickly in a small amount of fat over medium-high heat
saute.notes: Water loss ~15%, plus oil absorption ~3-5g per 100g. Uses 'fried' nutrition multiplier

pan_fry.description: Cook in moderate amount of oil over medium heat
pan_fry.notes: More oil absorption than sauté, ~8-10g per 100g

deep_fry.notes: Significant oil absorption, loses crispness when reheated

stir_fry.description: Cook quickly in wok over very high heat with constant stirring
stir_fry.notes: Fast cooking preserves texture, minimal water loss

roast.description: Cook in oven with dry heat, uncovered
roast.notes: Significant water loss in meat ~25%, vegetables ~20%. Uses 'grilled' nutrition multiplier

bake.description: Cook in oven with dry heat, often covered
bake.notes: Less water loss than roasting due to covered cooking

grill.description: Cook over direct heat source (outdoor grill or grill pan)
grill.notes: High heat causes fat drip and water evaporation

broil.description: Cook with direct heat from above in oven
broil.notes: Similar to grilling but from above

air_fry.description: Cook with circulating hot air, minimal oil
air_fry.notes: Less oil absorption than frying, similar crispness

sear.description: Brown surface quickly over very high heat
sear.notes: Surface browning only, interior remains rare

boil.description: Cook in rapidly bubbling water at 100°C
boil.notes: Pasta/rice absorb water (200-280%), vegetables lose nutrients to water

simmer.description: Cook in gently bubbling liquid just below boiling
simmer.notes: Gentle cooking, some evaporation over time

poach.description: Cook gently in barely simmering liquid

steam.description: Cook with hot vapor, not touching water
steam.notes: Best nutrient retention, minimal water loss

blanch.description: Brief boil followed by ice bath
blanch.notes: Sets color and texture, minimal cooking

braise.description: Sear then cook slowly in small amount of liquid
braise.notes: Long, slow cooking breaks down tough cuts

stew.description: Cook slowly in liquid, fully submerged
stew.notes: Liquid becomes part of dish, nutrients retained

pressure_cook.description: Cook with steam under high pressure

heat.notes: Minimal cooking, just brings to serving temperature

caramelize.description: Cook slowly over low-medium heat until natural sugars brown and develop deep flavor
caramelize.notes: Major water loss ~35%, low and slow is key to avoid burning

reduce.description: Simmer liquid to concentrate flavors through evaporation
reduce.notes: Significant volume reduction concentrates flavors and nutrients

deglaze.description: Add liquid to hot pan to lift browned bits
deglaze.notes: Quick process, some evaporation during bubbling

fold.notes: Delicate mixing to preserve air bubbles

toss.description: Mix ingredients by lifting and turning
toss.notes: Quick mixing method, best done just before serving

whisk.description: Beat rapidly to incorporate air or combine liquids
whisk.notes: Can increase volume through air incorporation

knead.description: Work dough to develop gluten structure

cream.description: Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy

blend.description: Puree or mix using a blender
blend.notes: Minor loss to residue in blender

emulsify.description: Combine oil and water-based liquids into stable mixture
emulsify.notes: Requires constant agitation, can separate if not stored properly

marinate.description: Soak in seasoned liquid to add flavor and tenderize
marinate.notes: Slight weight gain from liquid absorption

brine.description: Soak in salt water solution to add moisture and flavor

ferment.description: Transform through bacterial or yeast action

pickle.notes: Quick pickles ready in hours, fermented pickles take days

rest_meat.description: Allow cooked meat to rest so juices redistribute
rest_meat.notes: Critical for juicy meat, never skip this step

proof.description: Allow dough to rise through yeast fermentation
proof.notes: Volume increase through CO2 production, no weight change

cool.description: Lower temperature to stop cooking or set texture
cool.notes: Stops cooking process, allows setting for desserts and baked goods

thaw.description: Bring frozen ingredient to refrigerator temperature
thaw.notes: Slow thawing in fridge is safest method, 8+ hours for most items

garnish.description: Add final decorative or flavor elements

slice_to_serve.description: Cut cooked dish into portions for serving

categories.prep: Raw preparation steps - no heat applied

notes.yieldFactors: Yield factor represents: output_weight / input_weight. <1.0 = loss, >1.0 = gain (from absorption). These track PHYSICAL WEIGHT changes for material throughput calculations, separate from per-gram nutrition changes in nutrition-multipliers.json
notes.yieldFactorOverrides: Ingredient-specific yield factors that override the base yieldFactor. Example: 'shell' has 0.50 base but 0.88 for eggs
notes.timeEstimates: Base time + (per ingredient time × number of items). Active time = hands-on work. Passive time = unattended (can do other tasks)
notes.parallelizable: Can this process run simultaneously with others? True for oven/passive processes, false for active stovetop work
notes.heatLevel: Cooking temperature category: none, low, medium, medium_high, high, very_high
notes.nutritionRefs: References keys in nutrition-multipliers.json for cooking method impacts
notes.prepAhead: Shelf life in hours from prep time. Storage location: fridge, freezer, counter
notes.prerequisites: Array of process IDs that should typically be completed before this process
notes.aliases: Alternative names/terms for the process to aid AI parsing
notes.applicableTo: Uses standardized ingredient categories for consistency
notes.version: v2.0.0 - Major update with all 10 improvements, January 2026
notes.schemaChanges: Added: parallelizable, passiveTime, heatLevel, yieldFactorOverrides, prerequisites, aliases. Updated: equipment naming standardized, applicableTo uses categories, added 14 new processes
